main_definition: Fair, sensible, or rational in nature; not extreme, exaggerated, or out of the ordinary.

meanings_and_examples.example: The price for a pizza was reasonable considering it included extra toppings.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Capable of being reasoned with; open to discussion and compromise
meanings_and_examples.example: She had a reasonable attitude towards the disagreement, willing to discuss options to find common ground.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Fit within normal standards or expectations
meanings_and_examples.example: The length of the deadline was reasonable given the complexity of the task at hand.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In agreement with logic and sound judgment; logical
meanings_and_examples.example: His argument for why we should take a break seemed quite reasonable to everyone in the room.
